title.narrative: IRF 5 - Sustaining Life-Saving and Humanitarian Relief to Communities Affected by Drought (BRiCS Consortium)

description.narrative: Action Against Hunger, CARE, CESVI, Concern, International Rescue Committee, SCI and IMC have come together in the BRiCS Consortium to address the severe drought situation in Somalia.

The project will lead activities in the following sectors:
Food Security: IRF4 was already providing safety nets to around 52,000 households, and this scale-up will add another 15,000 households to the current case-loads. Recommendations stemming from needs assessments and Cluster guidance include the continuation of cash grants to affected households to allow immediate access to basic needs and to prevent further asset depletion leading to destitution.
Health: To ensure consistency and harmonization of interventions across the target locations, the consortium partners will implement a standard package of activities in their allocated locations. Health activities will be provided through a combination of mobile clinics, Primary Health Care Units (PHU), Health Centre (HC) and Referral Health Centre (RFHC), and in some cases in hospitals.
Nutrition: To ensure consistency and harmonization of interventions across the target locations, the consortium partners will implement a standard package of activities in their allocated locations. Nutrition activities will tackle both Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM) in children under 5, including treatment of SAM cases with medical complications, and Moderate Acute Malnutrition (MAM) in children under five as well as pregnant and lactating women (PLW). Nutrition interventions are centered on the Community-based Management of Acute Malnutrition (CMAM) approach integrated with Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF).
Water, Sanitation & Hygiene: Water trucking will not be used. Rehabilitation of non-functioning water points and provision of spare parts (generator, pumps, maintenance kits…) will be implemented, including the very necessary hygiene promotion and education related to AWD/Cholera prevention. Household water treatment and storage will be provided.
